message.content: Yes, the authors briefly discuss the potential negative societal impacts of their work in the "Broader Impacts" section (B.5). They acknowledge potential issues with the dataset and mention that they have carefully examined the dataset to remove any improper content, such as pornographic information, racial remarks, or harmful social bias. They also express their intention to remove any antisocial data points based on feedback to ensure the goal of AI for the common good. However, the discussion is not extensive and could benefit from a more in-depth exploration of potential negative impacts.

Yes, the authors discuss potential negative societal impacts of their work in the "Broader Impacts" section (B.5). They mention that they have carefully examined the dataset and did not find any improper content, such as pornographic information, racial remarks, or harmful social bias. They also adhere to the goal of AI for the common good and will remove any anti-social data points based on feedback. However, they do not go into the detail about the negative impacts that could arise from the misuse of their work.

Yes, the authors discuss potential negative societal impacts of their work. In the "Broader Impacts" section, they mention that the SCIENCEQA dataset does not contain any personally sensitive information. They have carefully examined the dataset to ensure it does not contain improper content such as pornographic information, racial remarks, or harmful social bias. They commit to adhering to the goal of AI for the common good and mention that any anti-social data points will be removed from the dataset based on feedback.
